means: 符合行为准则的行为（或举止）

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词都有"练习，训练，锻炼"之意。
means: drill ： 侧重进行有系统的，严格和重复的练习。
exercise ： 主要指为强壮体魄而进行的锻炼，也可指进行练习以保持已经获得的技巧。
practice ： 指把所学的理论或知识用于实践以获得技艺与技巧。
training ： 普通用词，泛指为从事某种职业而进行的身体或智力方面的训练。
discipline ： 既可指训练又可指为达到某种熟练程度而进行的约束。

sentence.Network_en: To start a revolution, you need discipline, incisiveness and articulacy.
sentence.Network_cn: 要革命，就要守纪律、看得远、善表达。

sentence.Network_en: The aim of discipline is to teach children to behave acceptably.
sentence.Network_cn: 纪律的目的是教育儿童举止得体。

sentence.Network_en: The discipline of studying music can help children develop good work habits.
sentence.Network_cn: 音乐学习中的训练可以帮助孩子们培养好的工作习惯。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'mortification by scourging oneself'): via Old French from Latin disciplina 'instruction, knowledge', from discipulus (see disciple)

encyclopedia.content: 专辑介绍 Janet Jackson 2008 最新专辑 Discipline 惩罚 这张珍娜杰克森又将席卷流行乐坛， 最新单曲 FEEDBACK爱的回报刚发行就受到乐迷的注意， 曲风以走向电子舞曲， 不缺时尚新潮未来感， 可以到Youtube可以搜寻的到， 很值得新一代的年轻乐迷注意， MV一上新造型及舞蹈也将引起仿效， 整齐划一的群舞， 排行榜的成绩应该可以一扫之前成绩不佳的阴霾 天后大战第一发，Janet Jackson跳槽至Island Records的首张作品–“Discipli

entry.def: Discipline is the practice of making people obey rules or standards of behaviour, and punishing them when they do not.

example.ex: Order and discipline have been placed in the hands of headmasters and governing bodies.
example.tran: 维持秩序和纪律的工作已交接给了校长和管理机构了。

entry.def: Discipline is the quality of being able to behave and work in a controlled way which involves obeying particular rules or standards.

example.ex: It was that image of calm and discipline that appealed to voters.
example.tran: 正是那个冷静、自律的形象打动了选民。

entry.def: If you refer to an activity or situation as a discipline, you mean that, in order to be successful in it, you need to behave in a strictly controlled way and obey particular rules or standards.

example.ex: The discipline of studying music can help children develop good work habits.
example.tran: 音乐学习中的训练可以帮助孩子们培养好的工作习惯。

entry.def: If someone is disciplined for something that they have done wrong, they are punished for it.

example.ex: The workman was disciplined by his company but not dismissed...
example.tran: 那个工人受到了公司的处罚，但并没有被解雇。

example.ex: Her husband had at last taken a share in disciplining the boy.
example.tran: 她的丈夫最后也加了进来一起教训那个男孩。

entry.def: If you discipline yourself to do something, you train yourself to behave and work in a strictly controlled and regular way.

example.ex: Out on the course you must discipline yourself to let go of detailed theory...
example.tran: 在高尔夫球场上，你必须训练自己做到不拘泥于细枝末节的理论。

example.ex: I'm very good at disciplining myself.

entry.def: A discipline is a particular area of study, especially a subject of study in a college or university.

example.ex: You've got to make sure that people work together across disciplines...
example.tran: 你必须确保让那些出身不同学科的人一起共事。

example.ex: We're looking for people from a wide range of disciplines.
example.tran: 我们需要各个学科的人才。

"anthropology is the study of human beings"

means.word_mean: 1. train by instruction and practice; especially to teach self-control;
2. punish in order to gain control or enforce obedience;

sentences.sentence: "The teacher disciplined the pupils rather frequently"

Sentence.sentence: Under these circumstances, it's natural to look for what may appear to be the most "practical" way out of the problem "Major in a subject designed to get you a job" seems the obvious answer to some, though this ignores the fact that many disciplines in the humanities characterized as "soft" often, in fact, lead to employment and success in the long run.
Most of them did not have any sense of discipline.
As a poet, Ted Hughes had an acute sensitivity to the way in which constraints on self-expression, like the disciplines of metre and rhyme (韵律), spur creative thought

Moreover they site several advantages: alleviation of school overcrowding, strengthen family relationships, lower dropout rates, the facts that students are allowed to learn at their own rate, increased motivation, higher standardized test scores, and reduced discipline problems.
There is considerable and justified concern that the United States is falling behind much of the rest of the developed world in these essential disciplines

sentences.en: She must have been well disciplined for her orderliness.
sentences.cn: 她有条不紊, 一定受过良好的训练。

sentences.en: They disciplined him to be patient.
I've disciplined myself to do two hours of exercise every day.
sentences.cn: 我坚持每天锻炼两个小时。

sentences.en: The boy was often disciplined for staying away from school.
sentences.cn: 那孩子常因为逃学而受到处罚。

means.word_mean: 训练, 锻炼, 训导

sentences.en: She needs the discipline of having to write an essay every week.
sentences.cn: 她需要进行每周写一篇文章的训练。

sentences.en: Our soldiers showed perfect discipline under heavy fire from the enemy's guns.
sentences.cn: 在敌人的炮火下, 我们的士兵表现出良好的纪律。
必须对这个孩子加以惩罚。

sentences.en: Mathematics and physics are related disciplines.
sentences.cn: 数学和物理是相关学科。

jushi.english: She must have been well disciplined for her orderliness.
jushi.chinese: 她有条不紊,一定受过良好的训练。

jushi.english: The teacher disciplines the new comers at the beginning of the new term.
jushi.chinese: 新学期开始时教师都要对新生进行训练。

jushi.english: The boy was often disciplined for staying away from school.
jushi.chinese: 那孩子常因为逃学而受到处罚。
